comment: The differentiable predicate. A function ` F ` is differentiable at ` B ` with derivative ` C ` iff ` F ` is defined in a neighborhood of ` B ` and the difference quotient has limit ` C ` at ` B ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Dec-2016.)
